Posts.Content: freeariesonline wrote: Hi everyone!  Say I was just going down the conversations and I saw the notfication from lbbc.org about the conference they are having in Philadelphia in May.  Have any of you been able to find out anything in reguard to it.  I tried to go to the website but for some reason the library's computer wont let me go to that site.  Can anyone help me? Robin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: know anything more about the lbbc. org conference freeariesonline waterlily

Posts.Content: freeariesonline wrote: Hi everyone, Just curious, has anyone looked into alternative herbal suppliments to help cope with side effects?  My hubby and I were reading in Mamm magazine that Ginsing is supposed to help with weakness but in another magazine that I also got from the clinic it says that women with breast cancer should avoid using Ginsing because it could increase estrogen levels.  Talk about contradicting!   I've also been wondering about Milk thissel which is supposed to support liver fuction.   My mother in law died in 2000 from hepatitis and she's the one who first told me about it when she was checking out herbal suppliments.  However her oncologist told  her not to take it when she was getting her shots. Just curious!  Robin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: herbal suppliments anyone? freeariesonline heatherpalmerton

Posts.Content: freeariesonline wrote: I want to post but I'm afraid to bring anyone down.  But I know I'll feel better so here goes. Called the doctor Sunday because I was yellow from head to toe.  He decided to have me go into the office Monday for blood work rather than take me  away from my  family.  Got the results Tuesday the 23rd...not good news.  Seems my liver is being taken over by the cancer and they are now telling me I may have months not years.   Good Christmas present, right?!!  Blew me right out of the water!!  They offered me a medical trial at Lake Ireland Cancer Center in Cleveland that is testing drugs on people like me.  In fact I got the call today that I have an appointment on Jan 9th to see the doctor in charge.  I am hoping and praying whatever they offer can put my liver back into stability.  In the  meantime I've decided to contact Hospice to help my family cope with all of this.  They're offering grief councilling for everyone and I know we all need that.  They are also helping out with some of my drugs and with spiritual councilling.  Chemo has been completely eliminated because it was causing more harm than good.  I'm also not allowed to take Aleve anymore so they brought out the big guns Oxycotin.  Haven't had to take any and don't plan on it unless its absolutely necessary. I'm hoping against hope that the doctors are wrong and that somehow I can rally and get better.  Miracles happen right?  Robin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I don't plan on going down without a fight freeariesonline LuAnnH

Posts.Content: freeariesonline wrote: I'm a little confused at the moment.  I went to get my next chemo treatment today only to be told that I was being taken off the Abraxane because there had been no changes in the leisions between May and my last scan on the 1st of July.  I will still be on the Avastin and the Zometa and don't get me wrong I'm not going to miss the numb feet and the bald head at all,  but it just seems a little early to stop chemo.   He told me the largest leision is 5 1/2 cm x 2 1/2 cm or something in that ball park.  I mean I understand Quality of life and all but I guess I just don't understand this wait and see attitude.  Is this common practice?  I mean I've only been having treatments since April. Robin Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: confused? freeariesonline freeariesonline
